titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to United States Mail Line Company
CWG13704

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; 1863 Office Expenses - Telegraph, Stationary - Transportation - Ordinance Stores; Bundle 3

body.p:
NO. 12.The State of Kentucky,
To United States Mail Line Co Dr.
I certify that the journeys above charged were performed on business connected with recruiting service and by order of the Governor of Kentucky

Jno. W. Finnell
Adjt Genl Ky Vols
I certify that the above account is correct and just; and that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.
Received at Frankfort, the 11 of Decr, 1863, of S G Suddarth, Quarter-master ^General^ Kentucky Volunteers the sum of Ten Dollars and fifty Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 12.No. 50 Abstract B U Qr. 186
United States Mail Line Coy
Dollars $1050/100
Paid 11 Decr 1863
10." Cavy
AC
Transportation
Needs correction
J 232
